intro: Lunathyrium auriculatum var. zhongdianense, commonly known as the Zhongdian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, preferring cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are lanceolate and often bear a fuzzy texture, while its stems are upright and branching. This variant is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive blooms.
